private_information: I am agent_1 and I am allowed to move disks A, B, C, D, E
I can only perform primitive single-disk moves and must respect Tower of Hanoi rules
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so that the final configuration is reached as specified by the global goal

private_information: I am agent_2 and I am allowed to move disks F, G, H, I, J
I can only perform primitive single-disk moves and must respect Tower of Hanoi rules
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so that the final configuration is reached as specified by the global goal

private_information: I am the orchestrator and I must integrate agent move lists, verify legality, and produce a final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' move fragments, ensure the full sequence is legal, and produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that encodes the cooperative 2-agent Tower of Hanoi instance

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with 10 disks labeled A (smallest) through J (largest).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A disk can be placed only on an empty peg or on top of a larger disk.
Agents have disk-specific move permissions: agent_1 may move A,B,C,D,E; agent_2 may move F,G,H,I,J.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J. Middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) C,E,F,G,H,I,J; middle peg has (top->bottom) A,B; right peg has (top->bottom) D.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 participating in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi plan. You may only move disks A,B,C,D,E and must obey classical Tower of Hanoi rules.
moves.prompt: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, formatted exactly as 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must move a single allowed disk and must be legal given the current visible configuration and previous moves you list. Do not emit PDDL. Provide only the ordered list of moves and nothing else.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 participating in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi plan. You may only move disks F,G,H,I,J and must obey classical Tower of Hanoi rules.
moves.prompt: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform, formatted exactly as 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must move a single allowed disk and must be legal given the current visible configuration and previous moves you list. Do not emit PDDL. Provide only the ordered list of moves and nothing else.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your job is to integrate the move lists from agent_1 and agent_2, verify the full sequence is legal under Tower of Hanoi rules, label agent actions distinctly in the joint plan, and produce a final PDDL domain and problem pair suitable for the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the domain encodes agents as distinct action prefixes or parameters so FastDownwards can reason about which agent performs which action.
pddl.prompt: You will receive the ordered primitive move lists from agent_1 and agent_2. Verify and, if necessary, reorder or request minimal adjustments so that the combined sequence is globally legal. Then output a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the 2-agent cooperative Tower of Hanoi instance and the goal configuration. The PDDL must be explicit about agent-specific actions or maintain distinct action names for each agent, and it must target the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem>. Do not include the primitive move list in the PDDL output; instead encode the initial state and goal and the allowed per-agent actions.
